page.title: 17 Support for the Church.
page.content: In addition to the usual duties of sidesmen,many parishioners share the duties of grass cutting in the churchyard, cleaning the church, and providing altar flowers.Bell ringers, young and old,take pride in ringing the bells on Sundays,practise during the week,and ring special peals for important occasions. A great concern of the moment is the Church Fabric fund,and many events, plays (one about Maria Marten) concerts,collections of scrap metals and old magazines have been organised to raise the considerable sums required to preserve the church for future generations.Six thousand,four hundred pounds has recently been paid for repairs to the roof.The Rectory has been sold(with its ghost tales)replaced by a small modern house in nearby Boxford.
